com.iha.emulator.utilities.logging

Class AdapterLogger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.iha.emulator.utilities.logging.AdapterLogger

  • public class AdapterLogger
extends java.lang.Object
    Class providing GUI components and method for adapter to write in three types of log:
    - "Adapter's Log" - global messages by adapter and it's sensors - "To Be Sent Log" - showing unsent messages - "Error Log" - showing errors that occurred on adapter and it's sensors
    Also provides logs buffering to given file.
    Author:
    Filip Sutovsky

    • Property Summary

    • Method Detail

      • log

        public void log(java.lang.String message)
        Write message to buffer file and "Adapter's Log" GUI component. Checks, if GUI component should clear it's messages.
        Parameters:
        message - message to be written

      • checkIfRemove

        public void checkIfRemove()
        Checks if number of messages in "Adapter's Log" is bigger than BUFFER_LINE_COUNT_MAX. If it is, "Adapter's Log" component is cleared and mar is set to 0.

      • addTextToLog

        public void addTextToLog(java.lang.String text)
        Adds given string to "Adapter's Log" component.
        Parameters:
        text - text to be shown.

      • sent

        public javafx.scene.text.Text sent(java.lang.String message)
        If showing unsent messages is enabled, adds new message to "To Be Sent Log" component.
        Parameters:
        message - message to be written
        Returns:
        GUI component representing given message

      • error

        public void error(java.lang.String message,
                  boolean terminate)
        Writes error message to "Error Log" component. Changes color of error tab according to error level. Also if termination is set, error event is fired.
        Parameters:
        message - message to be written
        terminate - true if error event should be fired, false otherwise

      • notifyDataSent

        public void notifyDataSent(javafx.scene.text.Text message)
        Removes text of successfully sent message from "To Be Sent Log". If cannot remove immediately, message is moved to removeLater list and is dealt with later.
        Parameters:
        message - text of message, that is to be removed

      • processRemoveLaterMessages

        public void processRemoveLaterMessages()
        Process removing of messages, that were supposed to be removed.

      • setBuffered

        public void setBuffered(boolean buffered,
                        java.lang.String filename,
                        java.lang.String path)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Creates and opens buffer file. If path given as parameter is null, temp file is created.
        Parameters:
        buffered - flag, if logs should be buffered
        filename - buffer file filename
        path - path to buffer file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - cannot create file or directory

      • openBufferFile

                    throws java.io.IOException

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - cannot open file

      • writeTaskLogHeaderToBuffer

        public void writeTaskLogHeaderToBuffer(SimulationTask task)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Writes default information about SimulationTask to log.
        Parameters:
        task - task providing information
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - cannot write to buffer file

      • writeAdapterLogHeaderToBuffer

        public void writeAdapterLogHeaderToBuffer()
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Write default header of "Adapter's Log" to buffer file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - cannot write to file

      • initWarningCounter

        private void initWarningCounter()
        Initializes connection warnings counter. If there are more connection warnings then MAX_WARNING_COUNT, error message is sent and error event is fired.

      • setShowToBeSent

        public void setShowToBeSent(boolean showToBeSent)
        Sets flag, if unsent messages should be shown. Also disables "To Be Sent Log" tab, if not.
        Parameters:
        showToBeSent - true if unsent message should be shown, false otherwise
